N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 479.10 - Suspension pending hearing

State Regulations
(a) Pending a hearing, an accused member may be suspended without pay: (1)
after charges have been filed against
him; or
(2)
immediately in an
emergency situation where, in the judgment of the superintendent, the continued
status of the member as a police officer may constitute a danger to himself or
others, and/or the public interest may be seriously jeopardized. In this event, charges will be filed as soon as possible after suspension. (b) The period of suspension
without pay shall not exceed 30 days, unless: (1)
the hearing is delayed beyond 30 days by
the accused member's action or that of his counsel; or
(2)
unusual circumstances exist beyond the
control of the superintendent that prevent filing of charges and/or the holding
of a hearing within 30 days. (c) The 30-day limit may be extended by the
length of the delay or the duration of existing unusual
circumstances. Notes
